snippet: The Taliban claimed responsibility for the death of Fateh Khan, a member of the Awami National Party, and five others in the Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Province.
abstract: Fateh Khan, prominent Pakistani anti-Taliban politician, is killed in suicide bombing in northwestern Pakistan, underscoring dangers faced by politicians who stand up to insurgents.

byline.contributor: Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Bannu, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The Taliban claimed responsibility for the death of Fateh Khan, a member of the Awami National Party, and five others in the Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Province.

headline.seo: Suicide Bomber Kills Anti-Taliban Politician in Pakistan
headline.main: Bombing Kills Taliban Enemy in Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Bombing Kills Taliban Enemy In Pakistan
